intro: Crabbea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy crabbea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Crabbea hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
